content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>Originally developed by Public Works - Wastewater Management Division. Currently updated, edited, and maintained by City and County of Denver - Technology Services - DenverGIS</origin>         <pubdate>20100405</pubdate>         <title>Streams</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>City and County of Denver Wastewater Management Storm Facility Data showing the streams, creeks, and gulches included in the Storm Network.</abstract>       <purpose>Hydrographic features (Rivers, Creeks and Selected Gulches) within the City and County of Denver.  </purpose>       <supplinf>This data set is a view of the PWWMD_NAT_STREAMNETWORK_L feature class within the SD.PWWMD_Storm_Facility feature dataset.   Data is designated by the following definition: TYPE = 'River' OR TYPE = 'Creek' OR NAME = 'Dry Gulch' OR NAME = 'Goldsmith Gulch' OR NAME = 'Harvard Gulch' OR NAME = 'Lakewood Gulch' OR NAME = 'Sanderson Gulch'</supplinf>     </descript>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>As needed</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-105.123219</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.566758</eastbc>         <northbc>39.996256</northbc>         <southbc>39.600111</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>hydrology</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:  This data set is provided as read-only. Contact the GIS Data Administrator for more information on distribution requirements/restrictions.     USE CONSTRAINTS:  The City and County of Denver is not responsible and shall not be liable to the user for damages of any kind arising out of the use of data or information provided by the City and County of Denver, including the installation of the data or information, its use, or the results obtained from its use.   ANY DATA OR INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE City and County of Denver IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  Data or information provided by the City and County of Denver shall be used and relied upon only at the user's sole risk, and the user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the City and County of Denver, its officials, officers and employees from any liability arising out of the use of the data/information provided.   NOT FOR ENGINEERING PURPOSES </useconst>     <datacred>Denver Public Works - Wastewater Management Division; Denver Technology Services / GIS Data</datacred>     <secinfo>       <secsys>AVAILABLE</secsys>       <secclass>Unclassified</secclass>       <sechandl>Available to the general public and posted on the Denver FTP (File Transfer Protocol) site.</sechandl>     </secinfo>     <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850</native>   </idinfo>   <dataqual />   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Vector</direct>     <ptvctinf>       <sdtsterm>         <sdtstype>String</sdtstype>         <ptvctcnt>463</ptvctcnt>       </sdtsterm>     </ptvctinf>   </spdoinfo>   <spref>     <horizsys>       <geograph>         <latres>8.9831528411952133e-009</latres>         <longres>8.9831528411952133e-009</longres>         <geogunit>Decimal Degrees</geogunit>       </geograph>       <geodetic>         <horizdn>D WGS 1984</horizdn>         <ellips>WGS 1984</ellips>         <semiaxis>6378137.0</semiaxis>         <denflat>298.257223563</denflat>       </geodetic>     </horizsys>   </spref>   <eainfo>     <detailed>       <enttyp>         <enttypl> PWWMD_MANAGER.PWWMD_BND_STMDETENTION_A</enttypl>       </enttyp>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>FACILITYID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Unique identifier for each feature.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>WARRANTYDATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The date when the San or Stm line was completed.  Built brand new.  The warranty date is usually good for two to three years after completion.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD - CityWorks Attribute</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LOCATION</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Nearest intersection or State Plane Coordinate.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD - CityWorks Attribute</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LEGACYID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Old ID or the original ID given at data conversion.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD - CityWorks Attribute</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CONDITION</attrlabl>         <attrdef>PACP (Pipe Condition Code).  The standard code given to the pipe which describes breaks, cracks, and overall rating.  Taken from the TV Inspection.  The "Condition" has a rating value of 0 through 5 and is based on the "Overall" pipe structure from Cityworks and WinCan.  Zero (0) means the best - NO defects.  Five (5) means the worst and needs to be replaced.  This pipe "Condition" will be used as a benchmark for the City and County of Denver "Master Plan" used to forecast which pipes need to be replaced or lined.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD - CityWorks Attribute</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CONDITIONDATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>When the PACP (Pipe Condition Code) was done.  Taken from the TV Inspection.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD - CityWorks Attribute</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CREATED_BY</attrlabl>         <attrdef>User ID or person creating the data.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CREATED_DATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Date or date and time stamp when the data was created.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>ENABLED</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Field that holds a Boolean value indicating whether a network feature is enabled (true) or disabled (false) in the network.  A disabled feature acts as a barrier when the network is traced.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>0</edomv>             <edomvd>False</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>1 </edomv>             <edomvd>True</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CREATED_BY_AGENCY</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Agency creating the data.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>EDITED_BY</attrlabl>         <attrdef>User ID or person editing "existing" data.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>EDITED_DATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Date or date and time stamp when "existing" data was edited.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>EDITED_BY_AGENCY</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Agency editing "existing" data.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LIFECYCLESTATUS</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Status of the feature as defined on the As-Built. It will be indicated as one of the following: Potential, Active, Abandoned, Removed or Under Construction.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD Project As-Built</attrdefs>         <attrdomv> <edomv>5</edomv>             <edomvd>Water Quality Pond</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>6</edomv>             <edomvd>Lakes and Ponds</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>99</edomv>             <edomvd>Unknown</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>UNITTYPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Subtype text definition for the coded value; required for Locate View Map (LVM) application.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>MAPNO</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Map number: Location of feature by Range, Township, Section and QuartersSection.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.  Value obtained from an overlay with the Feature Class PWWMD_IDX_PLATINDEX_A, attribute PLATMAP.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DISTRICT</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Wastewater Maintenance Districts.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.  Value obtained from an overlay with the Feature Class PWWMD_BND_WWDISTRICTS_A, attribute QUAD.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>BASIN</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Polygons representing major drainage boundaries.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.  Value obtained from an overlay with the Feature Class PWWMD_BND_STMMAJORBASIN_A, attribute MAJORBASIN_ID.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SECBASIN</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Secondary Basin Polygons of secondary divisions of major basins.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.  Value obtained from an overlay with the Feature Class PWWMD_BND_STMSECBASIN_A, attribute SECBASIN_ID.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SUBBASIN</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Polygons representing the smallest component of a major basin.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.  Value obtained from an overlay with the Feature Class PWWMD_BND_STMSUBBASIN_A, attribute SUBBASIN_ID.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>INSTALLDATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Date the facilities were installed.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD Project As-Built</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>NAME</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Stream or natural feature name.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD - Storm Drainage System Maps.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GLOBALID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A field of type UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) in which values are automatically assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DOWNSTREAMNODEID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Facility ID of point on the downstream end of pipe.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>UPSTREAMNODEID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Facility ID of point on the upstream end of pipe.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>BYPASSNODEID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Upstreamnodeid of pipe that is intersected mid-pipe by another pipe without necessitating a pipe split.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Auto-populated by PWWMD data model application.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>INVISIBLE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>During stream network update completed by Matrix Design Group... the values "Replace" and "New" indicate whether the stream geometry was replacing the old geometry or added as a new feature.  The attribute label is not indicative of the value within the field.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Matrix Design Group, Inc.</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DRAINAGEID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Urban Drainage Flood Control District (UDFCD) project REUSE basin numbers.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Urban Drainage Flood Control District (UDFCD)</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SOURCE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Data Source.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Assessor Map, Denver International Airport (DIA) Data, Digitized, Ditch Map, Interpolated, USGS National Hydrography Dataset (NHD dataset), Storm Sewer, Urban Drainage Flood Control District (UDFCD).</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DATAPATH</attrlabl>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>TYPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Type of drainage feature:  Creek, Canal, Ditch, Gulch, Intermittent Stream, River.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>PWWMD</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LVMPATH</attrlabl>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE_Length</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Length of feature in internal units.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>City and County of Denver, Technology Services / DenverGIS Data</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>unknown</addrtype>           <address>201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 301</address>           <city>Denver</city>           <state>CO</state>           <postal>80202</postal>           <country>US</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntfax>720-913-5237</cntfax>         <cntemail>denvergis@denvergov.org</cntemail>         <hours>M-F 8:00am - 4:00pm (MST)</hours>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <distliab>See access and use constraints information.</distliab>     <stdorder>       <fees>This information is available at a time and material cost from the City and County of Denver. </fees>       <ordering>Digital products can be downloaded for free using the FTP site or can be requested by filing out the GIS Data Request Form and faxing it to (720) 913-5237, ATTN: Data Sales. All digital orders will be confirmed and processed by DenverGIS.  Use our online request form and acknowledge the GIS ordinance to download publically available GIS digital data. Please reference the following link - http://www.denvergov.org/gis and click on Products and Services, then click on Data Sales.; Technical Prerequisites: It is recommended to use DSL or T1 connections to download the information. If dial-up is used, please expect longer download times or incomplete data downloads.</ordering>       <turnarnd>10 working days.</turnarnd>     </stdorder>   </distinfo>   <metainfo>     <metd>20120712</metd>     <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn>     <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv>     <mettc>local time</mettc>   </metainfo> </metadata>
